title: AI in Monetary Policy: The Future of Central Banking?
description: How Large Language Models (LLMs) and Machine Learning could revolutionize — or destabilize — the way Central Banks understand the economy.
content: Hvad sker der, når man giver en centralbank en 'kunstig hjerne'? Mens ChatGPT skriver digte, undersøger økonomer, om AI kan forudsige inflation bedre end de klassiske DSGE-modeller.

Traditionally, central banks rely on models like the **Taylor Rule** to set interest rates. The standard formula is given by:

$$ i_t = r^* + \pi_t + 0.5(\pi_t - \pi^*) + 0.5(y_t - y^*) $$

Where $i_t$ is the target interest rate, $\pi_t$ is inflation, and $y_t$ is the output gap.
But what if we could use Reinforcement Learning to optimize $i_t$ dynamically? AI models can process vast amounts of unstructured data (news, sentiment) that traditional DSGE models miss.

Men er det sikkert? En 'black box' rentebeslutning er svær at forklare for offentligheden. Fremtiden ligger nok i hybrider: AI til 'nowcasting' og klassiske modeller til kausalitet og politik-simulering.
